verses.verse: {Israel's Sin} d {This v. is 12:2 in MT, and so throughout the chapter.} "Ephraim feeds on the wind, chasing after the eastern winds, storing up lies and desolation day after day. They are making a contract with the Assyrians, and sending oil to Egypt.
The Lord accuses Judah, and will punish Jacob according to his ways; he will repay him for what he does.
He circumvented his brother {Lit. He grabbed his brother by the heal} in the womb, and as an adult he fought with God.
He even fought the angel and won; he cried and prayed to him. Then at Bethel he found him, and there he spoke with us
the Lord God of the Heavenly Armies the Lord is his name. {Or his traditional name}
So you, return to your God; guard grace and justice, and look to your God always.
"Now as for the merchant, {MT word for merchant sounds like Canaan} deceitful balances remain in his hand, and he loves to defraud.
Ephraim claims, Â«I have become rich, I have made a fortune! Because of all my wealth, no one will find any iniquity or sin in me.'
"Yet I remain the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt. I will make you live in tents again, as in the festival of that name. {I. e. the Festival of Tents}
I spoke to the prophets, giving revelation after revelation, and employing parables in the prophetic writings. {Lit. parables by the hand of the prophets}
"There's iniquity in Gilead, isn't there? They have become truly vain. They sacrifice bulls in Gilgal; their altars are like piles of stone in furrowed fields.
Jacob fled into the land of Aram; {I. e. Syria} Israel served there to obtain his wife, tending sheep to gain {The Heb. lacks to gain} his wife.
"By a prophet the Lord brought Israel out of Egypt, and by a prophet he {I. e. Israel} was rescued.
Ephraim has stirred up violent anger; therefore the guilt of his blood will remain on him, and his Lord will repay him for his contempt."
